title: For your viewing pleasure...(calligraphy attached)
content:
These are a couple scans of antique greeting cards from the early 20th century. "Art Publisher to Their Majesties the King and Queen", Raphael Tuck.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108174528im_/http:/typophile.com/files/cmasgreetingscalligsm_6203.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108174528im_/http:/typophile.com/files/withbestcalligsm_4634.jpg)

(Larger versions will be at my site next weekend.)
author: fontplayer

comments.content: Careful, that stuff could have your eye out
To quote the guy in the [Christopher Walken "More Cowbell" skit](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108174528/http:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=n_PILVkA0MY) on SNL, "What does that mean?"

sorry just an offhand reference to all the fine detail in the images, and a comment on the general hyper-embellished look -- if you imagined it as a three-dimensional object the slender bits if brought near to the eye could conceivably cause severe damage or even poke it completely out. Damn, it's not as fun when you have to explain it ;)

You must have a really good screen.  
; )
